results.adx_keywords: Heat and Heat Waves;Hikes and Hiking;Rescues;Deaths (Fatalities);Travel and Vacations;Emergency Medical Treatment;Summer (Season);Grand Canyon National Park
results.title: Saving Lives at the Grand Canyon, One Salty Snack at a Time
results.abstract: In a summer of deadly heat for hikers in the Southwest, rangers at Grand Canyon National Park use a pioneering approach of aggressive messaging and outreach to prevent disaster on the trails.

media.caption: In a recent training exercise, a Grand Canyon National Park staffer practiced maneuvering a loaded stretcher up and over the canyon rim. While search-and-rescue incidents across the National Park system have ticked upward alongside rising visitation in recent years, that’s not the case at the Grand Canyon.

results.title: A School Bus Crosses U.S., Linking Families of Mass Shooting Victims
results.abstract: As mass shootings multiply, relatives of the dead find support in “the worst club imaginable.” One child’s parents are on a road trip to connect them.

media.caption: Manuel Oliver, a Parkland parent, driving the converted school bus. Behind him is Brett Cross, who lost a relative in Uvalde, Texas.
